intro: Cardenanthus, commonly known as the Persian shield, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage and showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are often velvety and come in shades of green, red, and purple, adding ornamental value to gardens. Cardenanthus species are popular in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
